channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Covid: England lockdown rules to end on 19 July, Sajid Javid says
item.description: It means almost all legal restrictions on social contact in England will be removed.

item.title: Racist abuse of players 'unforgiveable' says Southgate
item.description: England manager Gareth Southgate says online racist abuse of Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho and Bukayo Saka is "unforgivable", after Prime Minister Boris Johnson and the FA condemn the social media posts.

item.title: Heathrow's long queues blamed on self-isolating staff
item.description: Terminal 5 sees long queues at security because staff were told to self-isolate by the NHS app.

item.title: Euro champions land in Rome to scenes of jubilation
item.description: The Italian football team arrived in Rome to scores of ecstatic fans and choruses of applause.

item.title: Marcus Rashford mural defaced after England Euro 2020 defeat
item.description: The artwork honouring the footballer's work to tackle child food poverty is vandalised.

item.title: Cuba protests: Thousands rally against government as economy struggles
item.description: Cubans have been angered by an economic crisis, anti-Covid measures and curbs on civil liberties.

item.title: Super Mario 64 game sells for record-breaking $1.5m at auction
item.description: An original Zelda cartridge and a Mario game set successive records at auction within days.

item.title: Jaipur: Lightning strike kills 16 taking selfies in India
item.description: The incident happened when tourists were at a popular fort in the northern city of Jaipur.

item.title: Jacob Zuma: Military deployed to tackle unrest over jailed ex-president
item.description: Shops are looted and buildings set on fire as the jailed former president challenges his sentence.

item.title: FA review after fans break into Wembley for final
item.description: The FA chief executive Mark Bullingham apologises to legitimate fans whose experience was affected.

item.title: UK bans fifth neo-Nazi group under terror laws
item.description: US group The Base, which aims to start a race war, is banned after recruitment efforts in Britain.

item.title: Euro 2020: No gloating in Little Italy over England loss
item.description: How is the mood in Bedford, which has 14,000 Italian descendants, after the Euro 2020 final?

item.title: In pictures: Joy and sorrow over Euro 2020 final
item.description: High hopes and nerves give way to sorrow as England lose to Italy on penalties.

item.title: 'Not seeing my disabled son during lockdown was awful'
item.description: Dawn Cavanagh says Jack, who lives in residential care, phoned her saying "mummy, come and get me".

item.title: Afghan woman 'unbroken' after being shot by her husband
item.description: Afghan woman Shakila Zareen had to have 22 operations after being shot in the face by her husband.

item.title: Cold water swimming: Mum’s campaign for safety skills
item.description: Beckie Ramsay, whose son Dylan died in 2011, wants children to be educated on the dangers of open water swimming.

item.title: Miami building collapse: Inside the recovery operation clearing the ruins
item.description: Miami-Dade Fire Rescue show how workers are clearing the "enormous" pile of ruins that remains.

item.title: Pandemic heroes' portraits to be pasted up in Bridgwater
item.description: A woman who helped depressed farmers is among those being honoured in a giant mural.

item.title: Thousands of fish dropped from plane to restock Utah lakes
item.description: Wildlife authorities in Utah do this to restock lakes that aren't accessible to other forms of transport.

item.title: Euro 2020: Why abuse remains rife on social media
item.description: Racist abuse aimed at football players following Sunday's tournament finale has been widely condemned.

item.title: Voice cloning of growing interest to actors and cybercriminals
item.description: Why voice cloning is not just a threat to actors but could benefit cybercriminals too.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Novak Djokovic should win 25 Grand Slams - John McEnroe
item.description: Novak Djokovic not going on to win 25 Grand Slam titles after claiming a record-equalling 20th would "be a major surprise", says John McEnroe.

item.title: 'Indians don't talk about sex - so I help them'
item.description: An Indian sex coach says parents turn to her for advice as sex education is not available in schools.

item.title: The foreigners in China’s disinformation drive
item.description: Foreigners are increasingly appearing on YouTube promoting China's narrative on issues like Xinjiang.

item.title: How did my phone number end up for sale on a US database?
item.description: A journey of discovery into the somewhat opaque, if lucrative, world of contact selling

item.title: Matsuyama, Watson and Johnson out of The Open as withdrawals mount
item.description: Masters champion Hideki Matsuyama out of The Open after testing positive for coronavirus, while Bubba Watson also withdraws due to a close contact testing positive.

item.title: Euro 2020: What lessons can England and Gareth Southgate learn from final defeat?
item.description: BBC Sport pundits Rio Ferdinand, Alan Shearer and Frank Lampard analyse Gareth Southgate's tactics in the wake of their penalty shootout defeat by Italy in the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: 'It is almost a fourth Test' - Murray to lead Lions against strong South Africa A side
item.description: Tour captain Conor Murray leads the British and Irish Lions for the first time against a strong South Africa A team in Cape Town on Wednesday.

item.title: McGregor 'feeling tremendous' after surgery and promises to return 'better than ever'
item.description: Conor McGregor promises to come back "better than ever" after having surgery on a broken leg sustained in defeat by Dustin Poirier.

item.title: 'I'm no Michael Jordan' - Antetokounmpo shines in crucial NBA Finals win
item.description: Giannis Antetokounmpo plays down comparisons to Michael Jordan after a historic display in game three of the NBA Finals.

item.title: Euro 2020: Watch the BBC's closing montage for England's emotional run to the final
item.description: Watch the BBC's closing montage for our coverage of Euro 2020, focusing on England's emotional run the final where they fell agonisingly short of a first European Championship.

item.title: Gareth Southgate: England boss hopes to lead team at 2022 Qatar World Cup
item.description: Gareth Southgate hopes to lead England at the 2022 World Cup but says he needs a rest before considering contract talks.

item.title: England's Euro 2020: 'They brought us joy that my generation have never felt'
item.description: BBC pundits react to England's Euro 2020 final defeat by Italy after penalty shootout heartbreak at Wembley.

item.title: Euro 2020 final: Italy manager Roberto Mancini says 'I was due this'
item.description: Italy manager Roberto Mancini says "I was due this" after his side beat England on penalties to win Euro 2020.

item.title: Euro 2020: How football brought this Oldham community together
item.description: The BBC's Ed Thomas spends Euro 2020 final day on an estate in Oldham, Greater Manchester.

item.title: Euro 2020: Italy fans ecstatic after England defeated in Wembley final
item.description: The Italian team is given a hero's welcome as it arrives home after defeating England on penalties.

item.title: Italy are champions three years after failing to qualify for the World Cup
item.description: Watch highlights as Italy beat England 3-2 in a tense penalty shootout to become European champions at Wembley.

item.title: Euro 2020 final: England boss Gareth Southgate says he chose penalty-takers
item.description: All too aware of the pain of a penalty miss, England boss Gareth Southgate rallied around the trio who missed theirs in the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: Sancho, Rashford, and Saka miss England penalties
item.description: Watch the decisive final penalties of the dramatic shootout as Italy beat England 3-2 on penalties to win the European Championship after a tense 120 minutes ended 1-1 at Wembley.

item.title: England and Italy fans react to Euro final
item.description: England's hope to end their 55-year wait for a major trophy ended with defeat in a penalty shoot-out as Italy claimed the Euro 2020 crown at Wembley.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Health Secretary Sajid Javid has confirmed government plans for lifting the remaining Covid restrictions in England.

item.title: Should I still wear a face mask or covering and what are the rules?
item.description: Wearing a face covering is currently a legal requirement in many places, but rules are changing in England.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government is considering allowing double vaccinated adults to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: I'm 17 - when will I be jabbed? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about England's roadmap out of lockdown, and other Covid-related issues.
